Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mastoparan-AF (MP-AF; XXA; Ala-rich; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 92.9% similarity toMastoparan M.  Mol formula:   C73H129N17O16; Mol Wt 1513.922; GRAVY= 1.08; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide: 0.64  kcal/mol.Activity:  Active against Gram+ S. aureus CCRC12652 or CCRC15211 (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), S. xylosus  (MIC 1.5 ug/ml), S. alactolyticus (MIC 8 ug/ml), Gram- C. koseri  (MIC 4 ug/ml), E. coli BL21 or JM109 Amp (MIC 4-8 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae CCRC10694  (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. Choleraesuis  (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. typhimurium CCRC12947  (MIC 32 ug/ml), V. parahamelytics CCRC10806 (MIC 16 ug/ml), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 96 ug/ml), including A. baumannii and its clinical strains (MIC 2-16 ug/ml).Structure:  random coils in water and helical in 8 mM SDS or 40% TFE.Toxicity: hRBC: not hemolytic till 64 ug/ml (<5%); <15% hemolysis at 128 uM, HC50 ~ 256 ug/ml (40% hemolysis). Similar results were obtained using chicken and sheep RBC.  human RBC: HC50 227.0 uM; rat RBC: HC50 107.3 uM. Less hemo.lytic (Ye et al., 2023).Updated 8/2024Updated 7/2021; 7/2024
Literature Information.Author: Lin CH, Tzen JT, Shyu CL, Yang MJ, Tu WC..2011
Literature Information.Title: Structural and biological characterization of mastoparans in the venom of Vespa species in Taiwan
